Define hard operational constraints that protect the trust-first narrative without diluting clarity for the primary pet-parent audience.

Define canonical dual-voice taxonomy (persuasive marketing vs neutral educational) with boundary tests, overlap rules, and prohibited crossover examples.
Produce editorial trust lexicon and terminology normalization guide for health-adjacent claims, certainty qualifiers, and authority signaling language.
Map voice-lead rules by context (owned-channel marketing vs publication-grade educational content) and define user-facing transition principles that preserve trust.
Enumerate exploit patterns where informative framing masks overclaims or persuasive framing degrades editorial credibility; define fail-state detection cues.
